results.title: Why does a flea jump?
results.creator_credit: Eiji Murayama and Sakura Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: The importance of scientific method and the way in which scientists work, is illustrated by the study of such common phenomena as fleas jumping. Describes various parasites around us, fleas, Tsutsugamushi mites, rat mites, hood-worm larvae and how they find hosts to suck their blood. Concludes that carbon dioxide is the stimulus which alerts parasitic mites to the presence of animals, thus food.

results.title: Why do we still have mountains
results.creator_credit: Stanley Croner, Warren Brown, American Geological Institute and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
Explains how mountains are formed by deformation of the Earth’s crust, showing that uplifting movements are occurring at present, and new elevations replace those being eroded.

results.title: Why didn't somebody tell me?
results.creator_credit: BNA Communications and Pare Lorentz Jr
results.brief_description: Mr Bleeker, a retiree, is called into the office to help with finances. He accuses one of the female staff with body odour. She is embarrassed and is consoled by the secretary who tells her it is a fact. Hence the title of the film. Mr Bleeker also berates staff who gossip, collecting for football pools and male staff annoying female staff. Mr Bleeker gives advice to various staff about wasting time, he considers proper dress, manners and decorum should be evident in the office. A grievance committee approaches management to complain about Mr Bleeker but in the end they resolve the problems themselves.

results.title: Why can't hippos climb trees?
results.creator_credit: Rob McCubbin, Education Department of Victoria for Zoo Education Services and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Gaye Hamilton, a zoo education officer and Year 11 students from Braybrook High School examine the different structures of animals that enable them to survive. Using video inserts and live animals in the studio they discover the adaptations of animals that enable them to live in trees, in water or on the ground.

results.title: Why'd the beetle cross the road?
results.brief_description: In answer to the question which has puzzled sages throughout the centuries, this short whimsical film gives us a bug’s eye view of the meaning of life. It stars a determined beetle who slowly makes his way across an ocean-side bikepath, humming a medley of familiar tunes while he evades or surmounts a series of obstacles.

results.title: Whose neighbourhood is this?
results.creator_credit: Mitchell Gebhardt Film Co and Richard Gebhardt
results.brief_description: Deals with the problem of serious crime, including interviews with victims of robbery and assault, police, and criminals. Gives advice on locks and security. The film is aimed at a general audience, and takes a “common man” approach.

results.title: Whoever says the truth shall die : A film about Pier Paolo Pasolini
results.creator_credit: VPRO, Harry Prins, Frank Diamond and Philo Bregstein
results.brief_description: Whoever Says the Truth Shall Die is a naked-truth documentary on the life and work of Italian filmmaker Pier Paolo Pasolini. Using still pictures, excerpts and extensive interviews, director Philo Bregstein charts Pasolini’s matriculation into one of the most controversial cinematic figures in the world. The film includes interviews with Pasolini’s long term collaborator, the actress Laura Betti, author Alberto Moravia, director Bernardo Bertolucci and others.

results.title: Who will teach your child?
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker, ONF | NFB and Stanley Jackson
results.brief_description: An analysis of the teacher’s vital role in a child’s development. Three important questions are raised; how can we attract people of superior ability to the teaching profession; how should these people be trained; once trained, how can they be persuaded to stay in the profession thus giving up more lucrative careers. Various classroom situations are used to emphasize the important part played by the teacher in moulding the development of the child. The film presents a challenge to all concerned - prospective teacher, parent, the community as a whole - for the teaching profession to receive true recognition and for children to find satisfaction in their search for knowledge.

results.title: Who was Jack Carrington-Smith?
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian State Film Unit and Ray Barnes
results.brief_description: A film about life and work of noted artist, teacher and Archibald Prize winner Jack Carrington-Smith. Features reminiscences by his friends and family. Introduced by artist Max Angus.
